title: SoC CSD 305-0-20 Phonetics
class_attributes:
Interdisciplinary Distro - See Rules

Natural Sciences Distro Area

Social & Behavioral Sciences Distro Area

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: CSD305 will provide an overview of clinical phonetics. Students will learn to hear, transcribe using the International Phonetic Alphabet, and analyze speech sound production. Students will learn basic anatomy of the speech mechanism and how anatomic movement shapes sound production. They will learn conventions for coding differences in speech sound production within and across languages and learn to compare and contrast sound productions. They will be introduced to ways this knowledge can be used within a clinical setting.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: The course format consists of three lectures and one lab session per week.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be evaluated through mid-quarter assessments, projects, participation/transcription in weekly labs, class participation and a final examination.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Small, L.H. (2016) Fundamentals of Phonetics: A Practical Guide for Students, 4th edition. Needham Heights, MA: Allyn and Bacon.
1. Students must purchase the fourth edition.
2. Students do not need to purchase the CD package.
3. ISBN13#: 978-0133895728
4. Purchase price: $152.53
